result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M Goldschmidt

records.addlTxt: WCS report dated 5/18/15.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph M Goldschmidt in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 14CF1062, Court grants the State's motion.
Plea hearing on May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Plea hearing on July 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph M Goldschmidt in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS letter addressed. Court orders Defendant to telephone into WCS. Defense advises that the State requested another date for plea at the end of May or early June due to Drug treatment court. Defendant will be out of his assessment in July. Court will give a review hearing in May and a date for a plea in July.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph M Goldschmidt
Current: 21595 Astolat Drive, Brookfield, WI 53045 United States  (Effective: 01-20-2015)
Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Hearing on March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph M Goldschmidt in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney LaVoy advises the Court the Defendant is on the wait list for Drug Treatment Court and is expected to be admitted the third week of March.  Hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Hearing on January 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Co signed by his father. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program within 1 business day of his release.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to apply with all rules of the program. Defendant to be released to his father, MIchael Goldschmidt on December 11 at or around 10:30 a.m.. Michael Goldschmidt will drive his son directly to NOVA Counseling Center in Oshkosh, Wisconsin with no stops. Joseph will comply with all rules of NOVA and will successfully complete the five week residential program. Joseph will remain absolutely sober. and Joseph will follow all aftercare suggested by NOVA including placement at a half way house after his five weeks of in patient and Joseph will sign all necessary releases so WCS can monitor his compliance with NOVA. In the event Joseph violates any of the above conditions, the surety bond is to be converted back to a $5,000.00 cash bail.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Joseph M Goldschmidt in court, in custody, with attorney Jonathan E. LaVoy.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Lavoy makes a Motion to Modify bail.  Hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Attorney Jonathan LaVoy
Preliminary hearing on December 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Prior: 21595 Astolat Dr, Brookfield, WI 53045
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program within 1 business day of his release.

Defendant Joseph M Goldschmidt in court, in custody, with attorney Jennifer Flynn.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
